title: Fattoush
description: Valentine Warner’s Middle Eastern salad recipe is quick and easy to make – great for a light midweek dinner.
ingredients: 3 pittas, halved lengthways and cut widthways into 3cm strips (or see tip)
4 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for frying
2 ripe medium tomatoes, chopped, or 16 ripe cherry tomatoes, halved
2 medium carrots, very finely sliced on the diagonal
½ medium red onion, finely sliced
2 little gem lettuces, halved lengthways and shredded widthways into 1cm ribbons
½ large cucumber, peeled and diced
Small handful of fresh mint leaves, torn
Pinch of hot chilli powder to taste

method.Step 1: In a small frying pan, sauté the pitta strips in a little extra-virgin olive oil, turning once, until crisp and golden. Drain on kitchen paper until cool.

method.Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the cooled pitta strips with the tomatoes, radishes, carrots, onion, lettuces, pea shoots, cucumber and herbs.

method.Step 3: In a small bowl, whisk the 4 tbsp oil with the lemon juice, then season with salt. Pour the dressing over the fattoush and toss, then serve sprinkled with the chilli and sumac.
